Syria is ' ready ' to return refugees , says the Foreign Minister .
Syria says it is ready for the voluntary return of refugees and calls for help in the reconstruction of the country devastated by more than seven years of war .
Foreign Minister Walid al-Moualem said before the United Nations General Assembly that conditions in the country are improving .
Today , the situation on the ground is more stable and secure thanks to progress in combating terrorism ,  he said .
The government continues to rehabilitate the terrorists ’ destroyed areas in order to restore normality .

Now there are all the conditions for the voluntary return of refugees to the country , which they have had to leave on the basis of terrorism and unilateral economic measures aimed at their daily lives and livelihoods .
The UN estimates that more than 5.5 million Syrians have fled the country since the beginning of the war in 2011 .
Another six million people still living in the country need humanitarian aid .
Al-Moualem said that the Syrian regime would welcome assistance in rebuilding the devastated country .
But he stressed that he would not accept conditional support or assistance from countries that have funded the insurgency .

New about algae blossoms : Concentrations in Pinellas , Manatee and Sarasota are descending .
The most recent report by the Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission shows a general decline in the Red Flight concentrations of parts of the Tampa Bay Area .
According to the FWC , only some spots with algae blossoms have been reported in Pinellas , Manatee , Sarasota , Charlotte , and Collier – a reduction in concentrations .
A blossom of the Red Flow extends over 200 kilometres from the northern Pinellas to the southern districts .
Stocks are about 10 miles off the coast of Hillsborough County , but less than a week ago .
Algae blossoms were also observed in Pasco County .

Last week , average concentrations in coastal proximity and on the open sea were reported in Pinellas County , low to high concentrations at the open sea in Hillsborough County , background to high concentrations in Managee County , background to high concentrations in coastal proximity and on the open sea in Sarasota County , background to medium concentrations in Charlotte County , background to high concentrations in coastal proximity and high seas in Lee County , and low concentrations in Collier County .
Breathing irritations are still reported in the districts of Pinellas , Managee , Sarasota , Lee and Collier .
Breathing irritations were not reported last week from Northwest Florida .
